place.name: LLANFIHANGEL CILFARGEN
place.gazetteerText: LLANFIHANGEL-CILFARGEN, a parish in Llandilo-fawr district, Carmarthen; on the river Dulas. an affluent of the river Towy, 5 miles WNW of Llandilo-fawr r. station. Post town, Llandilo, under Carmarthen. Acres, 516. Real property, £411. Pop., 58. Houses, 10. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £113. Patron, Earl Cawdor. The church was reported in 1859 as not very good (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
